title: Sweet potato & miso noodle broth
blurb:
The quickest of soups that uses three of my favourite flavour boosters:
coconut milk, miso and tamarind. The coconut cream brings a richness
which adds a depth of flavour. The miso brings umami which creates
layers of flavours, and the tamarind adds a sharpness which offsets

the coconut. They are ingredients | keep on hand for nights when food
needs to be fast. All sit happily in the cupboard or fridge for months. I've
purposely left the choice of green veg down to you so you can use what
you have and what's in season. Just be sure to cut things which take a

little longer to cook into smaller pieces, so everything cooks evenly.

ingredients.preparation: mixed with 4 tablespoons of cold water
shredded greens, broccoli and green beans

method: Fill and boil the kettle and put two pans on the hob. Once the kettle has boiled, fill one pan one-third full and add the egg noodles. Bring to the boil over a high heat and cook according to the packet instructions.

Next, pour 200ml water into the other pan, add the coconut milk and tamarind, grate in the ginger and put over a medium heat. Peel and thinly slice the sweet potato and add to the pan. Simmer over a high heat for 10 minutes or until the sweet potato is cooked.
In a small bowl mix the miso paste with 4 tablespoons of cold water.
Take the broth off the heat and stir in the miso mixture.

Once the noodles are cooked, divide between two bowls. Put the broth back on the heat, add the green vegetables to the broth and allow to simmer for 2-3 minutes until the vegetables are just cooked and any greens have wilted, then take off the heat. Ladle the soup over the noodles and top with the togarashi, herbs, chilli and spring onions.
